com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class DefaultScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.AbstractScheduler
      • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.DefaultScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MesosEventClient

    public class DefaultScheduler
extends AbstractScheduler
    This scheduler when provided with a ServiceSpec will deploy the service and recover from encountered faults when possible. Changes to the ServiceSpec will result in rolling configuration updates, or the creation of new Tasks where applicable.

      • unregistered

        public void unregistered()
        Description copied from interface: MesosEventClient
        Called after the framework has been unregistered from Mesos following a call to MesosEventClient.offers(Collection) which returned OfferResponse#finished() as a response. When this is called, the service should advertise the completion of the uninstall operation in its deploy plan.

      • getClientStatus

        public MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse getClientStatus()
        Description copied from interface: MesosEventClient
        Called periodically to check the client status. These responses are generally used to tell upstream something about the state of the client, and/or telling upstream to do something.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        offers - zero or more offers (zero may periodically be passed to 'turn the crank' on other processing)
        steps - candidate steps which had been returned by the PlanCoordinator

        Broken out into a separate function to facilitate direct testing.

      • getUnexpectedResources

        public MesosEventClient.UnexpectedResourcesResponse getUnexpectedResources(java.util.Collection<Protos.Offer> unusedOffers)
        Returns the resources which are not expected by this service.

        Resources can be unexpected for one of the following reasons:

        • The resource is from an old task and the service has since moved on (e.g. agent recently revived)
        • The resource is from a prior version of a replaced task (marked as permanently failed)
        • The resource is part of a task that's being decommissioned. In this case we also notify the decommission plan that the resource is (about to be) cleaned.
        Parameters:
        unusedOffers - The list of offers which were unclaimed in a prior call to MesosEventClient.offers(Collection)
        Returns:
        A subset of the provided offers paired with their resources to be unreserved/destroyed. May be paired with an error state if remaining unused offers should be declined-short rather than declined-long.

      • processStatusUpdate

        protected void processStatusUpdate(Protos.TaskStatus status)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractScheduler
        Invoked when Mesos has provided a task status to be processed.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        status - the task status, which may be for a task which no longer exists or is otherwise unrelated to the service
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • toUninstallScheduler

        public UninstallScheduler toUninstallScheduler()
        Creates a new UninstallScheduler based on the local components. This is used to trigger uninstall of a service without restarting the framework scheduler process. The created UninstallScheduler will automatically flag the service's StateStore with an uninstall bit.
